relation: 1. The subject matter of the course was useful
2. The subject matter of the course was interesting
3. The content of the course was delivered at an appropriate level of difficulty
4. The content of the course was consistent with the stated course

pageTitle: Assessment and Evaluation Research Initiative @ Teachers College :: Institute Participation and Feedback
textBeforeTable: Inaugural Institute Feedback Using Standardized Test Data for Global and Multicultural Test-takers: Best practices and Validity Standards Designing Standards-based Curricula, Student Learning Outcomes  Quantitative Research Methods -Sampling Techniques Qualitative Research Methods - Course Series Impact Evaluation Design - Course Series Top Five Choices of Inaugural Institute Attendees Course Preferences for Future Institutes? The AERI Inaugural Institute brought together 81 participants, including education faculty, graduate students, and professionals from around the world, such as Norway, China. Bangladesh, Nigeria, Sweden, India, Japan, Taiwan, Chile, and the USA.    Who attended the Inaugural Institute? AERI's activities include capacity building institutes for technical and non-technical audiences in global and domestic settings. AERI's inaugural institute was held in March, 2012.
